triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value Ratio Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The calculated Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or increasing the deposit to meet the LTV policy.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum LTV of 100% for Tier A applicants. The calculated LTV for this proposal is 91.11%, which is within the acceptable range for Tier A.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The Debt-to-Income (DTI) ratio is within the acceptable range for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: No immediate action required as the DTI is compliant.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum DTI of 45% for Tier A applicants. The calculated DTI for this proposal is 31.25%, which is compliant with the policy.

content.reasoning: The proposal was analyzed against the underwriting policy, focusing on credit score, affordability, and asset criteria. The applicant's credit score places them in Tier A, which allows for a maximum LTV of 110% and a DTI of 45%. The calculated LTV is 91.11%, and the DTI is 31.25%, both within acceptable limits. The vehicle's age and mileage are also compliant with the policy.
